verses.roman:
ity uktaḥ prasthito dūto
yathā-vad avadan nṛpān
te 'pi sandarśanaṁ śaureḥ
pratyaikṣan yan mumukṣavaḥ

synonyms: iti—thus; uktaḥ—addressed; prasthitaḥ—departed; dūtaḥ—the messenger; yathā-vat—accurately; avadat—he told; nṛpān—the kings; te—they; api—and; sandarśanam—the audience; śaureḥ—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; pratyaikṣan—awaited; yat—because; mumukṣavaḥ—being eager for liberation.
translation: Thus addressed, the messenger departed and accurately relayed the Lord's message to the kings. Eager for freedom, they then waited expectantly for their meeting with Lord Kṛṣṇa.

purport.content: The great Vaiṣṇava scholar Śrīla Jīva Gosvāmī comments here that by force of circumstances the kings began focusing their attention on Lord Kṛṣṇa alone.
